sources.title: The Crimes of Stephen Hawke
sources.description: “Perhaps Slaughter’s Best” “Spine-tingling fun” “This is a great movie” “The Spinebreaker!” (IMDB reviews quotes). Victorian horror with itinerant stage actor and melodrama specialist Tod Slaughter in the title role. Good supporting cast and good production values for a George King quickie. IMDB rating 5.7. Produced and directed by George King. Released in 1936 (UK only). Complete print

metadata.Plot: The film begins in a BBC studio with the 100th edition of "In Town Tonight". Flotsam and Jetsom open with a "topical number". Then there is an interview with a distinguished actor, which dissolves into a performance of one of his famous melodramas about a wicked moneylender etc.
metadata.Writer: Jack Celestin, Frederick Hayward, H.F. Maltby
metadata.Actors: Tod Slaughter, Marjorie Taylor, D.J. Williams
